title: CVPR_1999_15_abs

sentences.text: In this paper we specialize the projective unifocal , bifo-cal , and trifocal tensors to the affine case , and show how the tensors obtained relate to the registered tensors encountered in previous work .
This enables us to obtain an affine specialization of known projective relations connecting points and lines across two or three views .
In the simpler case of affine cameras we give neccessary and sufficient constraints on the components of the trifocal tensor , together with a simple geometric interpretation .
Finally , we show how the estimation of the tensors from point correspondences is achieved through factorization , and discuss the estimation from line correspondences .

Entity-affine_case.label: affine case
Entity-affine_case.description: A specialization of projective unifocal, bifo-cal, and trifocal tensors in computer vision, where the focus is on relating these tensors to registered tensors from previous work.

Entity-in_the_simpler_case.label: In the simpler case
Entity-in_the_simpler_case.description: The description refers to the specialization of trifocal tensors in the context of affine cameras.

Entity-the_component_of_the_trifocal_ten.label: the components of the trifocal tensor
aliases: the components of the trifocal tensor
Entity-the_component_of_the_trifocal_ten.description: The necessary and sufficient constraints on the individual elements or parts that make up the trifocal tensor in the context of affine cameras, along with their geometric interpretation.

mentions.local_name: the components of the trifocal tensor

Entity-trifocal_tensor.label: trifocal tensors
Entity-trifocal_tensor.description: A mathematical concept representing a type of tensor used for describing projective relations connecting points and lines across three views in computer vision.

Entity-a_simple_geometric_interpretation.label: a simple geometric interpretation
Entity-a_simple_geometric_interpretation.description: A set of constraints on the components of the trifocal tensor in the context of affine cameras, providing an intuitive and visual understanding of its structure.

Entity-the_projective_unifocal__bifo-cal.label: the projective unifocal, bifo-cal, and trifocal tensors
aliases: the projective unifocal, bifo-cal, and trifocal tensors
Entity-the_projective_unifocal__bifo-cal.description: A set of mathematical objects representing transformations between two or three views in computer vision, including unifocal, bifocal, and trifocal tensors.

mentions.local_name: the projective unifocal, bifo-cal, and trifocal tensors

Entity-bifo-cal.label: bifo-cal
Entity-bifo-cal.description: A type of tensor, specifically an affine specialization of projective relations connecting points and lines across two views.

Entity-projective_unifocal.label: projective unifocal
Entity-projective_unifocal.description: A mathematical concept and tensor representing an affine specialization of projective relations connecting points and lines across two views.

Entity-tensor_from_point_correspondence.label: tensors from point correspondences
Entity-tensor_from_point_correspondence.description: A mathematical representation of geometric relationships between points in multiple views, obtained through factorization and used for estimating camera poses or 3D structures.

Entity-the_trifocal_tensor.label: the trifocal tensor
Entity-the_trifocal_tensor.description: A mathematical object that represents the relationships between three images or cameras in a way that captures their relative positions and orientations.

Entity-this.label: This
Entity-this.description: The process of obtaining an affine specialization of previously established projective relationships between points, lines, and camera views.

Entity-registered_tensor.label: registered tensors
aliases: registered tensors encountered in previous work
Entity-registered_tensor.description: Tensors previously computed or measured, which are used as reference points for relating projective and affine transformations across multiple views.

mentions.local_name: registered tensors encountered in previous work

Entity-the_affine_case.label: the affine case
Entity-the_affine_case.description: The specific instance of camera perspective where projective transformations are reduced to linear transformations, allowing for simpler geometric interpretations and constraints.

Entity-the_estimation.label: the estimation
Entity-the_estimation.description: The process of determining the values of tensors through factorization, given point and line correspondences.

Entity-affine_camera.label: affine cameras
Entity-affine_camera.description: A type of camera model or transformation that preserves straight lines and ratios between distances.

Entity-known_projective_relation_connect.label: known projective relations connecting points and lines across two or three views
aliases: an affine specialization of known projective relations connecting points and lines across two or three views
known projective relations connecting points and lines across two or three views
Entity-known_projective_relation_connect.description: A set of geometric relationships between points, lines, and camera views in 2D or 3D space.

mentions.local_name: known projective relations connecting points and lines across two or three views
an affine specialization of known projective relations connecting points and lines across two or three views

Entity-projective_relation.label: projective relations
Entity-projective_relation.description: A mathematical concept that establishes connections between geometric entities, such as points and lines, across multiple viewpoints.

Entity-point_correspondence.label: point correspondences
Entity-point_correspondence.description: A set of pairs or matches between distinct points in an image or scene.

Entity-tensor.label: tensors
Entity-tensor.description: A mathematical concept or data structure used to represent multi-dimensional arrays of numerical values.

Entity-line_correspondence.label: line correspondences
Entity-line_correspondence.description: A set of pairs or mappings between lines in an image or scene that describe their geometric relationships.

Entity-point_and_line.label: points and lines
Entity-point_and_line.description: A geometric concept consisting of a set of points and lines, often used to describe spatial relationships and transformations.

Entity-view.label: views
Entity-view.description: A visual representation or perspective from which something can be seen, observed, or perceived.

Entity-estimation.label: estimation
Entity-estimation.description: The process or method of calculating an approximate value

Entity-factorization.label: factorization
Entity-factorization.description: A mathematical method or process that breaks down complex entities into simpler components or factors.

summary: In this paper we specialize the projective unifocal , bifo-cal , and trifocal tensors to the affine case , and show how the tensors obtained relate to the registered tensors encountered in previous work . This enables us to obtain an affine specialization of known projective relations connecting points and lines across two or three views . In the simpler case of affine cameras we give neccessary and sufficient constraints on the components of the trifocal tensor , together with a simple geometric interpretation . Finally , we show how the estimation of the tensors from point correspondences is achieved through factorization , and discuss the estimation from line correspondences .

Predicate-specialize_to.label: specialize to
Predicate-specialize_to.description: To specialize to means to focus one's attention or expertise on a specific area or domain, often implying a narrowing of scope from a broader field. This predicate indicates that the subject has concentrated its efforts and knowledge on the object, which represents a particular aspect or instance within that domain.

Predicate-relate_to.label: relate to
Predicate-relate_to.description: The predicate 'relate to' indicates a connection or correspondence between two entities (subject and object), suggesting that they share common characteristics, properties, or concepts. This relationship implies some level of similarity, analogy, or equivalence between the subject and object.

Predicate-have.label: have
Predicate-have.description: The predicate 'have' indicates possession or association between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject has or possesses the quality, characteristic, or meaning described by the object.

Predicate-have_constraints_on_the_compon.label: have constraints on the components of
Predicate-have_constraints_on_the_compon.description: This predicate indicates that there are restrictions or limitations imposed on the individual parts or elements that make up a given subject. The object specifies the type of constraints or rules that govern these components, effectively defining their properties and relationships.

Predicate-achieved_through.label: achieved through
Predicate-achieved_through.description: The predicate 'achieved through' indicates a means or method by which something (the subject) was obtained or accomplished. It implies that the object represents an approach, technique, process, or strategy used to attain or realize the subject.

Predicate-relate.label: relate
Predicate-relate.description: To connect or establish a connection between two entities (subject and object), often implying a sense of similarity, analogy, or correspondence.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or example of a more general category or concept represented by the object. In other words, it establishes a relationship between the subject and the object where the subject is a narrower or more specialized version of the object.
